meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wavy.
meanings.sent1: The wavinesses of her hair added a beautiful touch to her overall look.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the wavinesses of the ocean in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The wavinesses of the ribbon made it look like a dancing snake.
meanings.sent4: The field of wheat swayed with gentle wavinesses in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The wavinesses of the sand dunes created a mesmerizing landscape.

meanings.definition: The presence of waves or undulations.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed smoothly through the wavinesses of the water.
meanings.sent2: The seismic activity caused wavinesses in the ground.
meanings.sent3: The wavinesses of the flag made it look like it was waving underwater.
meanings.sent4: The music filled the room with wavinesses of sound.
meanings.sent5: The wavinesses of the fabric gave the dress a flowing appearance.

meanings.definition: A pattern of waves or curves.
meanings.sent1: The wallpaper had a lovely design with wavinesses running through it.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a painting with intricate wavinesses in the background.
meanings.sent3: The wavinesses of the road made the car ride feel like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved with graceful wavinesses in her performance.
meanings.sent5: The wavinesses of the clouds painted a beautiful picture in the sky.
